get.description: Either start_at or start_date is required

parameters.name: system_id
parameters.description: The unique numeric ID of the system

parameters.name: serial_no
parameters.description: Serial Number of the EV Charger

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity of the telemetry data. Possible values are 'week', 'day'. Default is 'day'

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Requested start date of the time series data. If the start_date and start_at is not provided, then the response data begins with the previous date as start_date. Pass as String date format YYYYMMDD.

parameters.name: start_at
parameters.description: Start time for fetching the telemetry data in Epoch time format. Alternatively one can use start_date in place of start_at for passing the start date as String in YYYYMMDD format. By default start_at will appear in response. If start_date parameter is passed in the url, then start_date field will appear in response.

example.details: Not authorized to access this resource

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Requested start date of the time series data. If the start_date is not provided, then the response data begins with the previous date as start_date. Pass as String date format YYYYMMDD.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: End date of the time series data. Defaults to yesterday. Pass as String date format YYYYMMDD.

consumption.description: All these values are in Wh
